headline: Why Analysts See BlackRock (BLK) Differently After The Latest Price Target Reset
summary: BlackRock’s latest price target change has put fresh attention on how investors are thinking about its role in the global asset management industry. With analysts revisiting their assumptions, the new target reflects updated views on the company’s scale, product mix, and positioning across markets. (NYSE: BLK), today announced the final January 2026 cash distributions for the iShares Premium Money Market ETF. Unitholders of record on January 27, 2026 will receive cash distributions payable on January 30, 2026. headline: BlackRock’s Rieder is Favored by Traders to Lead the Fed. Has Trump Found a Goldilocks Candidate?
summary: Rick Rieder, who oversees $2.7 trillion at BlackRock, has vaulted to No. 1 in betting markets as President Donald Trump’s pick for Fed chair. Credit his ideas, experience, and Wall Street fan club.

headline: BlackRock eyes new Bitcoin ETF with premium
summary: BlackRock has filed to launch a second Bitcoin ETF two years after the debut of its blockbuster product, IBIT. This one would feature additional income earned by selling call options on IBIT shares. Among traditional financial firms, BlackRock has been among the most aggressive to embrace crypto.

headline: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq rise to kick off key week with Big Tech earnings, Fed decision
summary: Markets are treading carefully ahead of a Fed rate decision and a big week of earnings from the likes of Apple and Meta.

headline: BlackRock Private Credit Fund Tanks
summary: Mounting losses in a business development company managed by BlackRock sent prices of the fund’s stocks and bonds tumbling Monday, reflecting mounting investor angst about the private-credit market.  BlackRock TCP Capital disclosed late Friday a 19% decline in the net asset value of the private corporate loans it owns tied to a sharp rise in nonperforming loans to about 10% of its portfolio.  The fund is one of several BDCs The Wall Street Journal highlighted in a report about troubled BDCs in December.

headline: Why BlackRock’s former crypto head is betting on Ethereum
summary: SharpLink CEO and former BlackRock head of digital assets strategy, Joseph Chalom, joins CoinDesk's Jennifer Sanasie on Markets Outlook. He explains why he believes Ethereum’s Total Value Locked (TVL) is poised for 10X growth in 2026. Chalom breaks down how stablecoins, RWA tokenization, and sovereign wealth funds are migrating to decentralized rails, effectively turning Ethereum into the "toll road" of global finance. They also dive into the rise of AI agents in DeFi and how SharpLink is pioneering a new institutional treasury model as the world’s second-largest public ETH holder.

summary: BlackRock filed for a Bitcoin income ETF using an options strategy to generate premium income for investors beyond spot price gains.

headline: Rate plans from Trump's Fed candidates may not be so different
summary: President Trump's hinted that he was going to announce his nominee to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve very soon in his address at the World Economic Forum (WEF) last week. In fact, Wall Street believes an announcement could be coming as soon as this week.Prediction markets have swung in favor of BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder.BofA Securities Senior U.S. Economist Stephen Juneau weighs in on whether a new Fed chair would change the narrative around interest rate policy for regulators. The US central bank is scheduled to release its first interest rate decision of 2026 this Wednesday, January 28.Be sure to check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on each of the possible candidates to be the next Fed chair: National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's Rick Rieder.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: BlackRock TCP Capital Stock Slides 14% as Fund Flags Bad News
summary: BlackRock TCP Capital  a private-credit fund, said it expects to take a hit to its net asset value for the fourth quarter, in what could be seen as another red flag within that market.  The fund revealed in a securities filing late Friday that its net asset value will decline 19% for the fourth quarter.  The write-down “is primarily driven by issuer specific developments during the quarter,” TCP said.

headline: BlackRock doubles down on bitcoin fund offerings with income-focused filing
summary: The ETF would actively manage a covered call bitcoin exposure through BlackRock's existing iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT), to generate income for investors.

headline: CVC Bets on U.S. Private-Credit Market
summary: CVC Capital Partners is betting on the growth of the U.S. private-credit market, striking a $1.2 billion deal to buy Marathon Asset Management.  The deal follows BlackRock’s much bigger wager on the growing demand for private credit through its $12 billion deal to buy HPS Investment Partners.  Buying Marathon will bolster the buyout firm’s position in real estate and asset-backed lending in the U.S. at a time when parts of the private-credit market are starting to show cracks.

headline: Financial trading master Rick Rieder emerges as possible Fed chief
summary:
The emergence of BlackRock's Rick Rieder as a Federal Reserve frontrunner means the US central bank could be led by a financial markets master less academically credentialed than other recent chairs.- Independent streak -
Ironically, the Fed chair from recent years whose profile most closely resembles Rieder's is probably Jerome Powell, the current central bank head, whom Trump has criticized relentlessly.
